data.text: Draws units inward while dealing damage.
Flies straight ahead and deals damage some time after landing.
Conjures a ward that reduces the damage taken by allies that enter it.
Conjures a ward that increases the movement and attack speed of allies that enter it.
Conjures a ward that continuously heals allies that enter it.
Conjures a ward that continuously damages enemies that enter it.
Conjures a ward that decreases the movement and attack speed of enemies that enter it.
Conjures a ward that stops time for enemies that enter it.
Flies straight ahead and deals damage upon landing.
Increases the HP of units on the board.
Heals allies within a certain area.
Descends upon a location, dealing damage.
You can now edit your loadout. Try experimenting with the various changes you can make.
A low-cost unit that can attack airborne or grounded enemies from a distance with his machine gun.
More expensive than the security officer, but also more powerful, as he carries a shotgun that deals severe damage to nearby units.
Approaches through the air and kicks foes when nearby. Effective against units that cannot attack airborne foes.
An airborne unit that douses enemies in flame. While he can hit enemies in a wide area in front of him, this unit has low HP.
Attacks nearby enemies with a somersault kick. Has low attack power, but high HP for a vanguard unit, and is thus suited for the front lines.
Attacks enemies around it with its saw blades. Although it is the most expensive vanguard unit, its durability helps make it incredibly formidable.
Ignores all other units besides the enemy headquarters. While it is the fastest unit in the game, it also has extremely low HP.
Remains stationary and spawns security officers at a steady rate. Each officer spawned reduces this unit's HP.
Uses Shield Bash to attack enemies in front of him. While he is slow, he has a large amount of HP.
Uses Shield Bash to attack enemies in front of him. He is more powerful and expensive than a normal riot trooper, and his attack range is also wider.
Fires grenades from range, which damage all foes within the blast radius. Though it moves slowly, its durability is rather high.
Attacks foes within a certain area. Whenever he is defeated, he spawns an enhanced shock trooper.
Moves through the air and attacks from range with machine-gun fire. The most expensive defense unit, but also the most powerful and only one that can fly.
Remains stationary and attacks grounded enemies with machine-gun fire. HP continually depletes after placement.
Remains stationary and attacks both grounded and airborne enemies at a distance with machine-gun fire. HP continually depletes after placement.
Remains stationary and attacks enemies from range with shockwaves. Possesses exceptional durability and attack power. HP continually depletes after placement.
Attacks enemies over a wide area. Possesses not only durability befitting its role, but high attack power as well.
Remains stationary and spawns riot troopers at a steady rate. Each trooper spawned reduces this unit's HP.
Attacks by firing grenades from range and damaging all foes within the blast radius.
A more expensive, more powerful grenadier. He attacks by firing grenades.
Can attack both grounded and airborne enemies from a distance with a shockwave. He has slightly higher HP than most ranged units, making him suited for the front lines.
Shoots flames at enemies in front of it. Though it is the most expensive ranged unit, its durability makes it incredibly powerful.
Approaches through the air and fires its machine gun at enemies from range. Effective against units that cannot attack airborne foes.
Approaches through the air and shoots balls of flame from range. When the orbs explode, they deal damage to all enemies within range.
Remains stationary and fires its laser at enemies from long distance. HP continually depletes after placement.
Remains stationary and fires missiles at enemies from range. Not optimized for close-range combat. HP continually depletes after placement.
Remains stationary and spawns grenadiers at a steady rate. Each grenadier spawned reduces this unit's HP.
Remains stationary and spawns slug-rays at a steady rate. Each slug-ray spawned reduces this unit's HP.
Wristguards capable of drawing out power latent in the wearer's body.
A vest favored by many a Shinra trooper.
Earrings fitted with a fragment of materia.
A golden amulet engraved with an ancient script. Increases one's powers of concentration.
A cloth band that keeps fatigue away when tied firmly around the head.
A five-pointed pendant that soothes the wearer in mysterious ways.
A ring for warriors who wish to tap into their more feral side.
Earrings imbued with a spirit capable of restoring one's fading consciousness.
A scarf that makes the wearer feel as if the wind is at their back.
An amulet that exalts the tutelary entities said to keep watch over the planet.
An elaborate neckpiece that imparts peace of mind to the wearer.
A pendant that is rumored to heighten the wearer's senses.
A device that converts one's visceral emotions into tangible fury.
A mystical cog capable of converting ethereal energy into power.
An amulet that seems to faintly cry "kupo" when worn.
A ring that makes the wearer feel as if they are a frog staring into the eyes of a viper.
A charm imbued with the fervent desire to be by one's side for eternity.
A belt made for the reigning workout champion.
Boots developed for soldiers fighting in rugged terrain.
A circlet said to have been worn by a fairy-tale sorceress.
A deck that consists solely of tarot cards found to be lucky.
A mysterious translucent orb that contains crystallized amber.
A distinguished emblem that purportedly lifts all burdens from the wearer's shoulders.
A magic ring that ensnares the heart and mind of any who look upon it.
Wristbands that push the wearer's muscles to their absolute limits.
An industrial-grade bulletproof vest issued to only the most elite of Shinra forces.
Extravagant earrings embedded with materia fragments.
A talisman said to have once been in daily use among the Ancients.
A neckpiece that radiates a light powerful enough to forge destiny anew.
A bracelet made of woven fabric representing the bonds of friendship.
A charming hair clip imbued with sacred orisons.
A memory module containing the data of a demon capable of terrible ferocity. Used with a chthonian armlet.
A memory module containing the data of a demon capable of terrifying sorcery. Used with a chthonian armlet.
A pair of wing-shaped earrings with the power to reinvigorate one's mind and body.
A belt declaring one's status as a superstar.
A beautiful crystal imbued with mako.
An armband crafted from bronze and as affordable as it is ubiquitous.
An armband crafted from iron. A sophisticated accoutrement with a reasonable price tag.
A titanium bangle supplied to all Shinra units.
A goth-chic bangle popular in the more fashionable circles.
A bangle inspired by the ever-turning cogs of fate.
A bangle developed to enhance the connections between materia.
A simple, homemade leather bracer made by the neighborhood watch.
A spiky bracer worn to express one's inner rebel.
A durable bracer with multiple materia slots to further fortify the wearer's defense.
A bracer manufactured by Shinra for its elite troops.
An elegant yet macabre bangle inspired by an ancient instrument of horror. Forgoes materia in favor of optimizing physical defense.
A sleek armlet graven with magic-warding glyphs.
An armlet made from specially refined mythril infused with magic-repelling properties.
An armlet with magic-warding properties that can be enhanced with materia.
An armlet wrought from naturally occurring age-old metals infused with magic.
A cuff that prioritizes one's magical defense over materia use.
A bracelet developed by tradesmen to make the most of materia.
A bracelet manufactured by Shinra. Designed for efficient materia usage.
A bracelet capable of holding a wealth of variegated materia.
A bracelet employing a symmetrical design to enhance materia links.
An extraordinary bracelet with a cruciform materia panel. Enhances materia resonance.
An armband supplied to all elite Wutai operatives.
An armband that allows the wearer to harness uncanny strength. Efficacy enhanced when worn with the accessories Gozu drive or Mezu drive.
An unembellished band designed to facilitate materia improvement.
An elegant piece of armor touched by the saving grace of an undying feathered creature.
A bangle designed in the image of the great city of Midgar.
A sleek bangle engraved with the Shinra company logo.
A tacky bangle bearing the don's mark.
Gives you a chance to learn certain enemy techniques that you've endured and use them as abilities. These abilities can only be used when the materia is set to your equipment.
Allows you to restore your own HP and cure poison with Chakra. The amount restored is relative to damage received, and more is restored the lower your HP.
Allows you to restore the party's HP with Pray.
Doubles ATB when activated. Cannot be used continuously. Press <button=ATB-boost> to activate.
Doubles ATB when activated. Cannot be used continuously. Press <button=L1> + <button=R1> to activate.
Increases your max HP. The total boost limit is +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your max MP. The total boost limit is +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your magic attack power. The total boost limit is +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases your luck. The total boost limit is +100% when more than one is equipped.
Increases the amount of gil you earn in battle.
Increases the amount of EXP you earn in battle.
Increases the effectiveness of items used in battle.
Increases ATB when staggering an enemy.
Increases how full the ATB gauge is at the start of battle.
Further decreases enemy damage and fills the ATB gauge faster when guarding.
Slightly fills the ATB gauge when multiple ATB commands are performed.
Attack command will do area damage immediately after dodging.
Guards against enemy attacks and allows you to quickly unleash your next move. Hold <button=guard> and press <button=dodge> to activate. Deals a small amount of damage.
Guards against enemy attacks and allows you to quickly unleash your next move. Hold <button=R1> and press <button=cancel> to activate. Deals a small amount of damage.
Slightly fills teammates' ATB gauges when ATB commands are used back-to-back.
Casts Cure on severely injured allies up to a set number of times. Will not activate if the character does not have enough ATB charges and MP, or the player is controlling the character.

Automatically uses Provoke to temporarily draw the enemy's attention when teammates are severely injured. Ineffective against powerful enemies. Will not activate if the player is controlling the character.
May do something after taking a number of steps with it set.

Allows you to use the Refocus limit break.
Can only be used once per battle.
Allows you to use healing spells.
Allows you to use curative spells.
Allows you to use revival spells.
Allows you to use fire magic.
Allows you to use ice magic.
Allows you to use lightning magic.
Allows you to use wind magic.
Allows you to use toxin-related spells.
Allows you to use disruptive spells.
Allows you to use time magic.
Allows you to use defensive spells.
Allows you to use subversive spells.
Allows you to summon a chocobo and moogle.
Allows you to summon a fat chocobo.
Allows you to summon a cactuar.
Allows you to summon a chocobo chick.
Allows you to expand the range of spells with the linked materia. To switch back to a single target, press <button=magnify> when selecting a spell.
Allows you to expand the range of spells with the linked materia. To switch back to a single target, press <button=L1> when selecting a spell.

Adds the element of the linked materia to your equipment, either infusing your attacks with that element or granting resistance to it. When more than one is set, only the first takes effect.

Works with fire, ice, lightning, and wind materia.

Grants resistance to the linked materia's status ailment.

Works with poison, time, bind, and subversion materia.

Allows you to recover HP when unleashing an attack of the linked materia's type.

Works with fire, ice, lightning, wind, poison, enemy skill, deadly dodge, and parry materia.

Allows you to recover MP when unleashing an attack of the linked materia's type.

Works with fire, ice, lightning, wind, and poison materia.

Allows an ally to follow the leader's attack command with an attack from linked materia.
(Does not consume ATB charges or MP.)

Works with fire, ice, lightning, wind, and poison materia.

Allows an ally to follow the leader's attack command with an attack from linked materia.

Works with fire, ice, lightning, wind, and poison materia.
Increases amount of AP earned for linked materia.
Allows you to perform Ninja Cannonball with <button=coop> while synergized. Fills Sonon's ATB gauge when the attack connects.
An indentification collar of mythril make. Developed for test subjects in Hojo's research facility.
Well-worn leather gloves that have seen their fair share of fights.
Gloves reinforced with metal to pack an extra punch.
Gloves with razor-sharp talons made of magic-infused mythril.
Leather gloves made from the hide of a ferocious beast.
Gloves with a sleek design. Well suited for setting materia.
A custom-order gun commissioned specifically to take down Shinra forces. Barret's longtime right-hand man.
A lethal, sturdy firearm with a large magazine.
A close-combat weapon with steel blades designed to slice enemies to ribbons.
A firearm that boasts unrivaled destructive force. Found in the slums' black market.
A firearm whose accuracy is dependent upon the wielder's emotional state.
A close-combat weapon capable of pulverizing enemies with a sphere of solid steel.
A vintage and well-cared-for staff. Also happens to be eco-friendly.
An elegant staff treated with silver. Perfect for those proficient in magic.
A staff sporting deadly blades on either end. Handle with care.
A rod made of mythril. Said to be a fabled mage's weapon of choice.
A solid and durable staff experimentally produced in Hojo's laboratory.
A staff infused with precious gems the color of twilight. Well suited for materia.
An oversized throwing star used by ninja from Wutai.
A peculiar thrown weapon that was once used to hunt game.
An exceptionally deadly weapon crafted from three scythe blades.
A throwing star modeled after a cactuar.
A simple, easy-to-wield staff used in Wutaian training exercises.
A battle staff capped with iron ingots heavy enough to shatter bone.
A numinous staff inside which a shaman is said to have sealed a great evil.
A large broadsword that has inherited the hopes of those who fight.
A greatsword cast from carefully selected iron ore.
A mighty blade able to cleave in one stroke anything foolish enough to stand in the wielder's way.
An immense sword made from magic-infused mythril ore.
A sword forged from two existing blades. Well suited for materia.
A crudely reinforced baseball bat. Designed to beat the living tar out of anything and everything.
Deals 500 physical damage to enemies within range.
Wind damage (Owner max HP percentage) description

A board for only the best players. A well-rounded board, but lacks the ATB charges necessary to deploy stronger units.

<color=orange>Total units: 5
Materia: Thunder, Aero, Stop, HP Up
ATB charges: 5
Speed: 3</color>

A board for those new to Fort Condor. Inlaid with the HP-restoring materia Cure.

<color=orange>Total units: 6
Materia: Fire, Cure
ATB charges: 8
Speed: 1</color>

A board for those new to Fort Condor. Inlaid with two orbs of attack spell materia.

<color=orange>Total units: 6
Materia: Blizzard, Aero
ATB charges: 6
Speed: 1</color>

A board for those new to Fort Condor. Inlaid with materia that increases unit HP.

<color=orange>Total units: 7
Materia: Thunder, HP Up
ATB charges: 8
Speed: 1</color>

A board for those new to Fort Condor. Fills the ATB gauge faster, allowing the user to deploy more units.

<color=orange>Total units: 6
Materia: Fire, Haste
ATB charges: 7
Speed: 2</color>

A board for intermediate players. Inlaid with three orbs of attack spell materia.

<color=orange>Total units: 5
Materia: Fire, Blizzard, Thunder
ATB charges: 9
Speed: 1</color>

A board for intermediate players. Inlaid with materia that provide support for units or increase their HP.

<color=orange>Total units: 7
Materia: Cure, Haste, Barrier, HP Up
ATB charges: 8
Speed: 1</color>

A board for intermediate players. Includes attack spell materia and a large number of ATB charges.

<color=orange>Total units: 5
Materia: Blizzard, Aero × 2, Slow
ATB charges: 9
Speed: 2</color>

A board for advanced players. Includes a large number of ATB charges to offset the lack of materia.

<color=orange>Total units: 8
Materia: None
ATB charges: 10
Speed: 3</color>

A board for advanced players. Inlaid with materia capable of increasing unit HP and providing support to the front line.

<color=orange>Total units: 8
Materia: Regen, Poison, Barrier, HP Up
ATB charges: 8
Speed: 2</color>

There are still items you can obtain by operating the machinery. If you put Aerith down now, you will no longer be able to use the console, and these items will become unobtainable.

Jump into the air and kick your foe from above.
Call forth fires from below to consume an enemy and others in the vicinity.
Leap high into the air and bring fiery doom to an enemy from above.
Throw a bomb that has a wide blast range.
Run toward an enemy and unleash a powerful kick. Significantly increases stagger.
Halve physical damage taken by all party members.
Halve magic damage taken by all party members.

Deal fixed damage multiple times. Poisons and slows enemies.
Deal lightning damage. Guaranteed to hit.
Deal wind damage and launch enemies toward you.
Summon a lance of lightning that deals damage to nearby enemies.

Fire countless homing lasers at an enemy. Deals increased damage with Umbral Aura active.
Strike an enemy with twin orbs of concentrated energy. Deals increased damage with Umbral Aura active.
Throws one or more giant bombs that create large explosions.
Cause a massive shockwave. Significantly increases stagger.
Spew a concentrated beam of water in a wide arc. Significantly increases stagger.
Harness and release a massive concentration of water to damage nearby enemies.
Jump into the air and strike your foe with a powerful attack.
Lunge toward an enemy with a piercing strike that hits multiple times. Significantly increases stagger.
Slash up to three enemies in quick succession. Hitting multiple foes increases its potency.
Wind up and unleash an overhead strike. Increased damage on stagger. Costs 2 ATB.
Unleash a wave of non-elemental mako energy at an enemy in front of you with a slash of your sword.
Brace for attacks and retaliate with a powerful slash.
Deliver a devastating attack and switch modes in one fluid motion.
Damage your foe while making an ominous symbol with your slashes.
Focus on a single enemy and deliver several powerful strikes. Significantly increases stagger.
Temporarily reduce damage taken and how easily you are interrupted.
Consume all ATB charges to unleash a concentrated burst of energy. Significantly increases stagger.
Take damage intended for other party members.
Consume all ATB charges to fire a long stream of bullets at an enemy.
Strike the ground and send nearby enemies flying.
Consume all ATB charges to deliver a close-range attack and send enemies flying.
Rush toward an enemy and launch them into the air with a furious blow. Increases Charge.
Shoot an orb of energy that creates a large explosion.
Marshal all your strength and channel it into a concentrated beam of energy. Significantly increases stagger.
Strengthen basic attacks and unique abilities.
Leap into the air and unleash a powerful kick.
Use in conjunction with basic attacks to more effectively pressure enemies.
Unleash a flurry of powerful strikes. Increases strength of next command executed.
Create an orb of materialized chi that deals damage on contact.
Deliver a tremendous blow at close range. Increased stagger damage bonus.
Evade, then unleash a charging attack. Moderately increases stagger.
Launch an enemy high into the air with a Zangan-style swift kick.
Unleash an unrelenting stream of acrobatic attacks. Significantly increases stagger.
Unleash an attack that absorbs MP. Absorbs additional MP from staggered enemies.

Deal magic damage to nearby enemies.
Conjure a magical shield that keeps enemies at bay and stops projectiles.
Fire an energy burst that hits multiple times. Increased stagger damage bonus. Costs 2 ATB.
Conjure a magical ward. Allies who use ATB within it regain partial ATB from your gauge. Costs 2 ATB.
Summon a fairy that attacks your enemies periodically as well as after you use abilities and spells.
Summon a soothing breeze to restore a moderate amount of HP to all party members.
Entreat the planet's favor to nullify physical damage dealt to all party members.
Expend ATB from Yuffie and Sonon so they can attack together.

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
Want to kiss your troubles goodbye?
Tired of being hung out to dry?
Our sweet little haven is your getaway,
because every day with us is a holiday!
</color>

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
Is the ground floor life getting you down?
Chin up now─there's no need to frown!
The Happy Turtle is here─and just in time.
Bringing so much cheer, it should be a crime!
</color>

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
Do lonely nights turn into lonely days?
Fill that void with booze, food, and play!
At the Happy Turtle, you'll find only the best,
For we live to entertain you, our honored guest!
</color>

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
Potential customer, is love what you seek?
Then the Happy Turtle can give you a peek!
Romance so often blossoms within our walls,
You'll want to stick around until last call!
</color>

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
A turtle with liquor, now ain't that a sight.
Why, it makes one brim with utter delight.
Two twin red cheeks, enchanting you wholly.
Drop by the Happy Turtle to drink it in slowly.
</color>

An ad for the Wutaian bar the Happy Turtle that reads as follows:

<color=orange>
Wutai's culinary enigmas are here to be shared.
Secret spices, mystic mixtures─but please don't be scared!
One quick visit is all you need,
To realize our food's great indeed!
</color>

"Merc,

I saw what you did for the people here, and on behalf of those you've helped, I just wanted to say thanks. You've shone a bit of sunlight on this dreary town. I attached a little something to this letter. It's not much, but I figured it might come in handy.

Don't forget: you've got an angel watching over you now.

The Guardian Angel of the Slums"

"Merc,

Thanks for catching the imposters and clearing my name. This is a token of my appreciation.

The Guardian Angel of the Slums"

The extreme conditions in which certain monsters thrive have provided them with unique curative abilities. My aim is to harness this skill in the form of materia.

Assess enemies to provide further intel.

Hit enemies vulnerable to fire, ice, or lightning using the appropriate magic.
(Number of attacks: <count=0> for each element)

Aiming to develop a new elemental materia based on an analysis of how fire, ice, and lightning magic affect their targets.

Data collection required.
Use unique abilities on staggered enemies and charge the ATB gauge <count=0> times.

Staggering a foe can be greatly advantageous in battle. Development of support materia capable of effectively triggering this state is currently being considered.

More field data needed to prove efficacy.

Research shows that staggering one's foes positively impacts morale in battle. I aim to analyze this phenomenon and replicate a similar sensation via materia.

More data is required before pursuing development.

Data compiled on the ice element has resulted in the successful reproduction of Shiva, the lady of frost. Combat behavior has yet to be tested.

Engage in simulated battle to gauge performance.

The extreme conditions under which certain monsters thrive have provided them with unique self-preservational instincts. My aim is to harness this skill in the form of materia.

Assess enemies to provide further intel.

Tests have shown that striking an organism with an element against which it is weak will impair its defense. Aiming to develop materia that makes use of this discovery.

Further field data required to determine viability of development.
Defeat 2 or more enemies with a single attack.

No two battles are ever the same. Utilizing the various situations that arise during combat, I aim to develop materia capable of emotional manipulation. I expect this to lead to higher combat efficiency. Development likely viable, pending additional data.

Overwhelm targets in combat to provide further intel.

Many monsters have subspecies, and much can be gleaned from the morphological disparities between each. They may even help shed light on the development of interlocking materia.

More data required to test theory.

Data compiled from monsters has resulted in the successful reproduction of a fat chocobo, the spirit often associated with fertility and harvests. Combat behavior has yet to be tested.

Engage in simulated battle to gauge performance.

The extreme conditions under which certain monsters thrive have provided them with a collective intelligence. I seek to understand this unique ability and reproduce it via materia.

Assess targets to provide further intel.

While analyzing the stagger effect, I verified the existence of a peculiar behavior presumed to be an acute response to stress. Theories suggest this effect can be harnessed as materia.

Further field data required before pursuing.

The activation of Refocus results in an accelerated attack frequency. Could applying said phenomenon to materia produce similar effects in allies?

Further field data required to prove validity.

Research into the stagger mechanism still ongoing.
Findings suggest that support materia could be used to increase one's advantage when target is staggered. Development being optioned.

Further field data required before confirming hypothesis.

Data compiled from elemental magic has resulted in the successful reproduction of serpent god Leviathan. Combat behavior has yet to be tested.

Engage in simulated battle to gauge performance.

The extreme conditions under which certain monsters thrive have imbued them with the ability to clone and imitate other species. My aim is to harness this skill in the form of materia.

Assess enemies to provide further intel.

It is said that special abilities may only be attained through rigorous training, but investigating this tried-and-true method could yield new combat support materia.

Confirmation requires more field data.
Master all <count=0> types of magic materia.

Magical efficacy has been shown to be proportional to MP consumption. Could research into a wide variety of magical invocations reveal that the production of MP cost-reducing materia is within reach?

Further field data required to confirm hypothesis.

Data from monster experiments reveals greater restorative capabilities in certain varieties compared to others of their species. Looking to harness this phenomenon in materia form.

Further field data required before pursuing.

Data compiled from all existing tests has resulted in the successful reproduction of Bahamut, king of dragons. Combat behavior has yet to be tested.

Engage in simulated battle to gauge performance.

Carbuncle Summoning Materia

Summon Carbuncle. The glittering jewel in its forehead grants allies extra strength.

Cactuar Summoning Materia

Summon a cactuar. It charges headfirst to deliver painfully spiky attacks.

Chocobo Chick Summoning Materia

Summon a chocobo chick. Runs hither and thither casting elemental spells.

Armor: Midgar Bangle

A bangle designed in the image of the great city of Midgar. Has a single materia slot.

Armor: Shinra Bangle

A sleek bangle engraved with the Shinra company logo. Has two non-linked materia slots.

Armor: Corneo Armlet

A tacky bangle bearing the don's mark. Has two linked materia slots.

Accessory: Superstar Belt

A belt declaring one's status as a superstar. Saves the wearer from death, once per battle.

Accessory: Mako Crystal

A beautiful crystal imbued with mako. Provides some protection against fire, ice, lightning, and wind attacks.

Weapon: Cacstar

A throwing star for Yuffie that happens to be shaped like a cactuar. Can be wielded in INTERmission.

Accessory: Seraphic Earrings

A pair of wing-shaped earrings that can reinvigorate one's mind and body. Automatically revives the wearer from incapacitation.

A large sentry weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. Highly mobile due to its many legs and armed with an array of heavy weapons. Deployed at Mako Reactor 1 to protect the core.

A large sentry weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. It is an outdated model used during the last war, so it is kept in storage in the corkscrew tunnel. Slow but heavily armored and bristling with powerful weapons.
A compact sentry weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. The gyroscopic control system enables high-speed flight. This machine tracks and engages intruders.

A large mobile weapons platform currently being developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Although still in the prototype phase, it was rushed into action to aid in the public execution of Avalanche members.
The separated right arm of an airbuster. Agile and quick in the air, it relentlessly tracks its targets.
The separated left arm of an airbuster. Agile and quick in the air, it relentlessly tracks its targets.
An operative with the Turks unit of Shinra's General Affairs Division. Fast and extremely agile, he leaps in to attack with his special Shinra-made security baton.
An operative with the Turks unit of Shinra's General Affairs Division. Fast and extremely agile, he leaps in to attack with his special Shinra-made security baton.
Floating mines deployed by Reno. They can track targets and inflict a paralyzing jolt of electricity on contact.
Special mines deployed by Reno. They can track targets and deploy an immobilizing electromagnetic shield.
An operative with the Turks unit of Shinra's General Affairs Division. As he possesses incredible strength and a well-toned physique, he prefers using his fists over weapons.
An operative with the Turks unit of Shinra's General Affairs Division. As he possesses incredible strength and a well-toned physique, he prefers using his fists over weapons.
Don Corneo's secret weapon, a monster in the form of a house. No one knows how it was built.
A giant beast that Don Corneo keeps in the sewers. Much more intelligent than it appears, it uses the surrounding environment to its advantage and attacks with sewer water.

A giant beast that Don Corneo keeps in the sewers. Much more intelligent than it appears, it uses the surrounding environment to its advantage and attacks with sewer water. When hunting for prey with its family, it will always command its offspring.
An aggregate of ghosts. The large amounts of baleful energy that result from this aggregation allow it to use telekinesis.
A ghastly fiend that haunts the train graveyard and feeds on human fear to grow stronger. It is a manifestation of the memories and sorrows that linger in the train graveyard.

An experimental specimen kept in the Shinra underground research facility. It was human once, but cellular transplants from various large creatures have turned it into a terrifying creature. It leads a group of failed test subjects.
Experimental specimens kept in Shinra's underground research facility. They were human once, but cellular transplants designed to enhance their strength have turned them into monsters.
A high-speed aerial weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. Its giant cannon launches grenades and status-ailment bombs.
A monster created by Shinra's R&D Division. Highly adaptable, it evolves during battle, where it exhibits extraordinary offensive and restorative capabilities.
Organisms extruded by the artificial life-form Specimen H0512. Capable of autonomous movement, they swarm around their parent to protect it from threats.
A top secret Shinra experimental specimen. Information on it is scarce, but it is believed to induce hallucinations.
Shinra's vice president and the son of the president. He carries a custom-made shotgun and is protected by Darkstar, a military canine.
A military canine serving as Rufus's personal guard dog. A one-off breed specially enhanced by Shinra's R&D Division, it follows its master's orders without hesitation, and will die to protect him.

An autonomous mobile weapons platform manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. It is armed with an extremely powerful cannon on its right arm and rotary cannons on its left. Equipped with cutting-edge combat AI, it calculates the most efficient method of annihilating its targets based on the situation.

An accretion of Whispers, the so-called arbiters of fate. The creatures appear when someone tries to alter destiny's course. They are connected to all the threads of time and space that shape the planet's fate.
Compact drones deployed by the Arsenal that erect magnetic shields to protect it.
A part of Jenova Dreamweaver. It appears at will from the ground and squirms in a repugnant manner.
An entity from a future timeline that has manifested in the present day. It fights with a sword to protect the future that gave shape to it.
An entity from a future timeline that has manifested in the present day. It fights barehanded to protect the future that gave shape to it.
An entity from a future timeline that has manifested in the present day. It fights with guns to protect the future that gave shape to it.

A multi-legged heavy weapons platform developed by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. It is armed with a large number of missiles that it uses to eliminate intruders seeking to gain access to Midgar's central pillar.
Small-scale drones deployed by the heavy weapons platform Gigantipede. Their containment lasers lock on to detected intruders to improve missile accuracy.
The director of Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. She has taken command of the battle armor she herself designed so as to torture and put an end to her unwitting test subjects.

Blood-red battle armor for Scarlet's personal use. Its creator's personality can be seen in every facet of this machine, from its extravagantly outfitted cockpit─that emphasizes form over function─to its arms' oversized weapons loadout.

A member of an elite unit within Deepground known as the Tsviets. Also referred to as Nero the Sable. He is capable of manipulating darkness─a power born of corrupted energy─and uses it to consume anything that stands in his way.
A depraved and ruthless Deepground SOLDIER recreated in a virtual space. Known as Weiss the Immaculate, he reigns supreme over Deepground.
Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Typically seen patrolling the city streets and company installations. Many are new recruits with little training.
Elite troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division who were promoted due to higher-than-average abilities. Usually deployed in dangerous zones where fighting is particularly fierce.
SOLDIER operators born from inhumane experimentation in a mad pursuit of power. They are confined to Shinra's top secret underground research facility, Deepground.
Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Largely tasked with providing support from the rear. They prefer to attack from a distance, but can fight up close when required.

Elite troopers serving in Shinra's Public Security Division who were promoted from the ranks of grenadiers due to their superior ability. Armed with portable artillery weapons, they are often deployed in key strongholds.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Protected by a large shield, they specialize in close combat. Often deployed in urban districts and company installations and used to break up violent demonstrations.
Elite troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division who were promoted from the ranks of riot troopers due to their superior ability. Easily identified by their spiked shields.
An elite trooper belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division and said to be the most dangerous of all Shinra troopers. He serves as a unit commander in the Sector 8 town area.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Equipped with flamethrowers that can target a wide area, they are used in monster extermination ops or when the enemy must be thoroughly obliterated.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. They wear power-enhancing suits and use rotors to fight while airborne. They perform reconnaissance and can pursue targets to areas where other troopers cannot.
Elite troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division who were promoted from the ranks of helitroopers due to superior ability. Equipped with high-performance suits and powerful engines.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Pharmacological agents and reinforced suits make these troopers tough to take down. They attack with metallic claws that are equipped to both arms.

Elite troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division who were promoted from the ranks of shock troopers due to their superior ability. These troopers can move along walls and ceilings and attack from any angle.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. Protected by reinforced armor developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division, and capable of inflicting heavy damage with their beam sword and heavy machine gun. As they are some of the most elite troopers in the military, they are tasked with guarding Shinra's HQ.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division who have been outfitted with Advanced Weaponry's latest in magically enhanced armor. They possess a number of mako-infused weapons which they use to eliminate intruders.

Troopers belonging to Shinra's Public Security Division. The rollers on their feet enable them to run circles around their targets. As they are some of the most elite troopers in the military, they are tasked with guarding Shinra's HQ.
Troopers belonging to Public Security who have been assigned security detail for Advanced Weaponry. They taunt and confuse their enemies with high-speed movements and frenzied magic attacks.

Special troopers that have been enhanced with mako energy. SOLDIERs are divided into three classes, based on their capabilities. The 3rd class is the lowest, but even they are vastly more effective than standard troopers.

A 3-C SOLDIER operator who loves bikes, speed, and anyone capable of going toe-to-toe with him. He is ostracized by many in the organization, however, due to his antics and general disregard for anyone's safety.
Bandits who prowl the slums. As bandits are wont to do, they gang up on vulnerable victims to steal their belongings.
Bandits who prowl the slums. As bandits are wont to do, they gang up on vulnerable victims to steal their belongings.
Bandits who prowl the slums. As bandits are wont to do, they gang up on vulnerable victims to steal their belongings.
Bandits who prowl the slums. As bandits are wont to do, they gang up on vulnerable victims to steal their belongings.
A member of Beck's Badasses, a gang based in the area around the collapsed road. Endlessly inquisitive, he constantly peppers Beck with questions. His special ability is playing dead.

Leader of Beck's Badasses, a gang based in the area around the collapsed road. Not the sharpest tool in the shed, he's especially bad at sizing up the strength of his enemies. His special ability is feigning knowledge of things.
A member of Beck's gang, which claims the collapsed road as its territory. He goes with the flow and lets Beck make all the decisions. His special ability is playing dead.
Don Corneo's underlings on the hunt for the most beautiful women in the undercity. They are always ready for a fight, and all have their own weapon of choice.
Don Corneo's henchmen. Some are former troopers, others common thugs hired off the street. They all have a favorite weapon they reach for when things get rough, and are always ready for a fight.
A man wearing clothes decorated with a gaudy dragon emblem. He appears to be looking for something in the Sector 7 slums with his cohorts.
Don Corneo's henchmen. Some are former troopers, others common thugs hired off the street. They all have a favorite weapon they reach for when things get rough, and are always ready for a fight.
A man wearing clothes decorated with a gaudy dragon emblem. He appears to be looking for something in the Sector 7 slums with his cohorts.
Don Corneo's henchmen. Some are former troopers, others common thugs hired off the street. They all have a favorite weapon they reach for when things get rough, and are always ready for a fight.
A man wearing clothes decorated with a gaudy dragon emblem. He appears to be looking for something in the Sector 7 slums with his cohorts.
Don Corneo's henchmen. Some are former troopers, others common thugs hired off the street. They all have a favorite weapon they reach for when things get rough, and are always ready for a fight.
A man wearing a vest with a gaudy dragon emblem. He appears to be looking for something in the Sector 7 slums with his cohorts.
Don Corneo's underlings on the hunt for the most beautiful women in the undercity. They are always ready for a fight, and all have their own weapon of choice.
Don Corneo's underlings on the hunt for the most beautiful women in the undercity. They are always ready for a fight, and all have their own weapon of choice.
A Don Corneo henchman. He wields a deadly dagger and makes monsters do his bidding. He puts these skills to good use in the Corneo Cup.
Hired muscle working for Beck's Badasses. With his massive bulk, he delivers devastating blows one after the other. He likes his fights clean and fair, and remains honorable in victory and defeat.
An autonomous weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Deployed to protect mako reactors and other important installations. It opens fire as soon as it detects intruders.
A modified version of the autonomous sentry ray weapons platform. Overall capabilities, including the effects of its lasers, are greatly enhanced.
An autonomous weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Deployed to protect mako reactors and other important installations. It opens fire as soon as it detects intruders.
An autonomous antipersonnel weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. It remains in sleep mode until it detects intruders, at which point it enters threat-elimination mode.
An early prototype of the sweeper. Due to a malfunctioning AI system that engineers could never fix, these units were deemed a failure and discarded in the slums...where they lived on.
An early prototype of the autonomous sentry gun weapons platform. When an intruder is detected, the platform opens fire with a rotary cannon. As it is a test model, the rate of fire is fairly low.
An autonomous weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. When an intruder is detected, the platform opens fire with a rotary cannon.
An improved version of the sweeper, outfitted with spinning saw blades at the end of each arm.
A cutter modified by a Wall Market local using scrap parts, then dumped illegally when it proved unstable.

An autonomous weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Able to rotate a full 360 degrees for improved surveillance. It has an extremely quick response time between detecting intruders and launching its homing missiles.

An autonomous weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Able to rotate a full 360 degrees for improved surveillance. It has an extremely quick response time between detecting intruders and launching its homing missiles.

An autonomous antipersonnel weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. Able to warp space-time and seemingly disappear into thin air. It warps close to targets and strikes with its hammer.

A self-piloting antipersonnel weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. This consummate killing machine is armed with a drill on its head, claws on its arms, and rotating blades on its torso.
A compact sentry weapon manufactured by Shinra's Advanced Weaponry Division. Its gyroscopic control system enables the unit to track and engage intruders from the air at high speeds.
A modified version of the slug-ray that is armed with high-voltage weapons, which immobilize targets.
A modified version of the slug-ray. Larger than the original model, but unable to fly. Equipped with rapid-fire grenade launchers that can eliminate multiple targets at once.
Large-scale robotic weapon. Development was discontinued because it was deemed too dangerous. Chadley used the project data to recreate a prototype within virtual reality.
A large-scale robotic weapon prototype recreated in virtual reality. In anticipation of its deployment, Chadley bestowed it with multiple performance-enhancing upgrades.

An autonomous antipersonnel weapons platform developed by the Advanced Weaponry Division. Equipped with a compact, high-displacement engine, it is capable of rapid, nimble movement that allows it to strike its target with ease.
A small device that floats inside Shinra's now-obsolete combat simulator. It contains stores of monster and weaponry data, which it uses to virtually construct training exercises.
Military canines trained by troopers from Shinra's Public Security Division. They are extremely obedient once trained, and can sniff out intruders and launch ferocious attacks when ordered.
Military canines trained by Shinra's Public Security Division. Genetic modifications have bestowed these animals with tentacles that can drain energy from their victims.
The result of administering ability-enhancing drugs to guard dogs. As a side effect, these dogs often went into a bloodthirsty frenzy, so most of them were put down...but some survived.
A creature that once stalked the plains outside Midgar but has since ventured into the city in search of prey. It has proliferated within the metropolis's walls and has become extremely ferocious.
Large rats that appeared in the slums in search of food. Wary and alert, they always move in packs.
A variant of the wererat, larger and more intelligent than its genetic relative. These creatures do not fear humans, and will seek revenge on those who harm their vermin brethren.
Large rats that run rampant throughout the undercity. Their poisonous bodies have allowed them to thwart potential predators and proliferate with ease.
Large insects that like dark, confined spaces. Usually encountered in tunnels and the plate interior. They ensnare their prey with sticky threads discharged from their mouth.
A subspecies of the grashtrike that is marked with yellow and black patterning on its carapace. It is also armed with a highly potent poison.

The queen of a grashtrike colony. As such, her duties include laying eggs and commanding her offspring in battle. Her main defense mechanism is the ability to spit sticky thread, with which she can trap her foes.

Azure-pigmented creatures that like dark, moist environments. Though fishlike in appearance, they also live on land. Despite being extremely timid, when their fight-or-flight response is triggered, they often fight rather than flee.
Aquatic monsters that prefer dark, moist places and feed on the blood of living creatures. They detect their prey through vibrations and temperature changes.

Mischievous creatures found throughout the slums. They first came to Midgar in search of food, and have proliferated since. They attack by charging into foes with the spines on their back, and by casting spells.
The leader of a hedgehog pie pack. This self-styled king wears a toy crown it picked up in the slums. It attacks by charging into foes with the spines on its back, and by casting spells.
Large insects found throughout the slums. They always move in swarms, scavenging for food scraps and preying on whatever crosses their path, whether it be a small animal or a human.
A gorger subspecies. Larger than their close relatives and armed with bladelike front legs. Drawn by the taste of human flesh, they often venture into residential areas.
An autonomous robot discarded by Shinra. As part of its self-repair protocol, it used nearby scrap material to put itself back together. It also intermittently emits smog.
An autonomous robot discarded by Shinra. As part of its self-repair protocol, it used nearby scrap material to repair its body. It knocks down foes by swinging its arm with a wrecking ball attached.

Large crustaceans that dwell in the sewers. They feed on dead bodies that are washed down into the sewers. They are rather territorial, attacking any and all intruders they see with their giant claws.
Aquatic creatures that have taken up residence in the sewers. They are intelligent enough to have created their own language, and they defend their territory with harpoons of their own fashioning.

A prince of the sewer-dwelling sahagin. He wields a special lance that symbolizes his royal status and is more powerful than that of a typical sahagin. He believes his species must take control of the surface world if they are to thrive.
Spell-weaving lizards with wings that are usually found floating about the train graveyard.
Spell-weaving airborne lizards that live in the slums. They are usually seen flying closer to the ground than their larger brethren.
Spell-weaving airborne lizards found in the Sector 5 slums. Inquisitive by nature, they cannot resist collecting shiny objects such as jewelry.
Nocturnal carnivores found in the train graveyard. These violent, aggressive creatures hunt for prey in packs, and will not hesitate to set upon humans.
Violent and aggressive, these nocturnal carnivores hunt for prey in packs and will not hesitate to attack humans.
A member of the horned cripshay's pack. When hunting, it will often swarm potential prey with its fellow packmates.
A unique variety of cripshay that is particularly large, ferocious, and rapacious compared to others of its kind. When it locates potential prey, it will command other cripshays to pounce en masse.
Spirits that drift about the train graveyard. These troubling pests set upon passersby and cause mischief as well as harm─to what end, no one knows.
Thought by experts to be a subspecies of ghost. Much like their relatives, however, they set upon passersby and cause mischief as well as harm─and no one can discern why.
Offspring of Don Corneo's pet, Abzu. These ferocious creatures live in herds down in the sewers. They immediately attack anything that moves.
Offspring of Abzu. These creatures live in herds down in the sewers. When accompanied by an adult, they follow its commands.
Offspring of Don Corneo's pet, Abzu. This creature lives in a herd down in the sewers. It is more intelligent and cunning than others of its ilk.
Large insects that live in the ground beneath Midgar. The collapse of the plate has made these creatures more active, and they will attack in swarms when intruders wander into their territory.
Large, floating balls of flame. The bigger they grow, the more dangerous they become.
A plush toy of unknown origins conjured up by a fat chocobo. Looks like a certain monster with four letters in its name.
These grotesque monsters have countless tentacles springing from their heads, along with a giant maw that spits a corrosive liquid and emits the most acrid of breath.
Enigmatic creatures purchased on the black market by Don Corneo. These green, robed fiends will slowly approach with no expression on their faces, but a lantern and a chef's knife in hand.
A plush toy of unknown origins conjured up by a fat chocobo. Looks like a certain monster with eight letters in its name.
A large bird found in the undercity. Capable of attacking with its ironlike bill, it has evolved to use its formidable wings as hands to seize potential prey.

A man-made monstrosity created by Shinra's Research and Development Division, it has since been disposed of for its cannibalic nature and disobedience. All that remains of it is the data stored in the combat simulator.
Bionic sentries created by Shinra's R&D Division. They are equipped with artificial intelligence and are used to guard mako reactors.
Modified version of the monodrive. Not only did these creations survive the Mako Reactor 5 explosion, the mako spill caused them to grow in both size and strength.
Monsters originally created by Shinra's R&D Division, but are now feral after some escaped the lab and bred in the wild.
An offshoot life-form that separated from a trypapolis.
A subspecies of the varghidpolis that was created in experiments that violated every precept of bioethics. They can multiply by simple fission.
A bionically modified subspecies of varghidpolis capable of flying thanks to levistones implanted in its body. This breed is now feral after some specimens escaped the lab and bred in the wild.

A bionic species created by Shinra's R&D Division. These specimens are difficult to control, as their behavior regulation mechanisms have not yet been perfected. They circle in the sky searching for quarry, then swoop down to attack.
A species created by Shinra's R&D Division by installing a copy of a human brain into a tank. Its primary method of attack is to expel the waste matter that builds up in that tank.

A species created by Shinra's R&D Division via the synthesis of parts from other life-forms. Physically powerful and extremely intelligent, they refuse to obey human commands, and thus are kept in quarantine.

A species that is the product of a particularly deranged series of experiments. These two-headed creatures have limbs and tails that ignite when provoked. Savage and ravenous, they leave nothing behind after catching their prey─not even bones.
Variant form of the behemoth. They are bred and raised as Shinra lab specimens and other monsters quake in fear at the sound of their roar.
Experimental specimens kept in Shinra's underground research facility. They were human once, but cellular transplants designed to enhance their strength have turned them into monsters.
A flame-wielding summon recreated in virtual reality. This entity is said to have given humans the gift of fire, and is widely known as the incarnation of creation and destruction.
An ice-element summon recreated in virtual reality. It is the manifestation of a queen who once healed the planet's wounds with ice, as evidenced by the existence of permafrost in the polar lands.
A pleasingly plump summon recreated in virtual reality. It is the manifestation of the legendary chocobo, a symbol of fertility and good fortune. Fat chocobos appear in many a beloved fairy tale.
A summon recreated in virtual reality. This entity is a tutelary dragon deity said to protect people from natural disasters. Today, most of its worshippers live in the vicinity of Wutai.

A legendary summon recreated in virtual reality. It is the manifestation of a dragon king revered by the original stewards of the planet. According to oral tradition, there are many Bahamuts, each with their own powers and forms.
Bahamut, as formed by the coalescence of three Whispers: Whisper Rubrum, Whisper Viridi, and Whisper Croceo.
A creature with a jewel set in its forehead. The light of said jewel grants its allies strength.
A cactus with legs that loves to run hither and thither. Watch out for its thorns!
A young chocobo. Though it may seem cute and innocuous, it is capable of casting powerful spells.
The fabled Lord of Levin recreated in a virtual space. He is said to have cast judgment on the wicked with mighty bolts of lightning and exhorted humanity to accept the ways of law and order.
A floating core summoned by Ramuh that generates and then feeds electricity to him.
A military helicopter used by Shinra for troop transportation, riot suppression, and surveillance.
A Shinra chopper piloted by Rude. In addition to forward-mounted machine guns, the chopper has napalm bombs that can be launched at ground targets.
A military helicopter used by Shinra, optimized for combat with mounted missile launchers.

Magic attacks have only a slight effect on its stagger gauge, and ice attacks have no effect on the gauge at all.
Magic attacks have only a slight effect on its stagger gauge, and ice attacks have no effect on the gauge at all.

Switches between physical and ghostly forms. Neither magic attacks against the physical form nor physical attacks against the ghostly form have any effect on its stagger gauge. Use magic attacks against the ghostly form to rapidly fill its stagger gauge.

When it is in the air, hit it with wind attacks to rapidly fill its stagger gauge. Unleash a leaping attack to knock it down to the ground.

Ice spells rapidly fill its stagger gauge, while melee attacks have only a slight effect on it, and long-range and other element attacks have no effect. Crippling its tentacles will cause it to reveal its heart, and attacking its heart will rapidly fill its stagger gauge.
Ice attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge. They rarely get interrupted unless attacked from behind.

Melee, lightning, and wind attacks rapidly fill its stagger gauge, but long-range and magic attacks have only a slight effect. All attacks have a slight effect on its stagger gauge during Limiter Override. Deal a certain amount of physical damage to slow its movements.

Melee and wind attacks rapidly fill its stagger gauge, but long-range and magic attacks have only a slight effect. All attacks have a slight effect on its stagger gauge during Limiter Override. Deal a certain amount of physical damage to slow its movements.
Once its health falls below a certain level, its stagger gauge cannot be filled.
Standard physical and magic attacks have no effect on his stagger gauge. However, hitting him with a certain attack when his guard is down will instantly stagger him.
All attacks have only a slight effect on its stagger gauge until its link with Rufus is broken.
While it runs an elemental defense protocol, attacks of those element have only a slight effect on the stagger gauge. Its stagger gauge is not affected at all when its barrier is online.
Melee attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge, but magic and long-range attacks have no effect.

Its head is susceptible to physical attacks, while its tail is susceptible to lightning attacks. Lightning attacks also rapidly fill its stagger gauge. Its long-range attack accuracy increases when its containment laser finds a target.
The accuracy of the gigantipede's missile attacks increases when their containment lasers find a target.
When her HP is depleted, she will faint and be unable to pilot the battle armor.

When its pilot is incapacitated, it will be susceptible to staggering. It is capable of equipping a variety of lethal artillery, but destroying these weapons will temporarily eliminate the threat they pose.
Though they are not seasoned fighters, they do know a variety of different attacks.
Blocking their melee attacks makes them easier to interrupt.
Striking them after their invisibility wears off will make them more susceptible to staggering. When captured by them, continuously press evade to escape.
These troopers carry powerful weapons such as grenade launchers. Try using magic to counter their long-range fire.
These troopers carry powerful weapons such as grenade launchers. Try using magic to counter their long-range fire.

Hitting these troopers in the back will eventually cause their fuel tank to blow and inflict significant damage.
While in midair, wind attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge. Evading their powerful aerial attacks makes them susceptible to staggering.
While in midair, wind attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge.

They evade all standard attacks except when they are attacking or knocked off their feet. Hitting them with fire attacks when they are staggered can detonate vulnerable parts of their suit and inflict significant damage.
They evade all standard attacks except when they are attacking or knocked off-balance.
While their core is exposed, they will unleash a powerful pulse laser. Destroying or stealing the core will weaken and render them susceptible to staggering.

Dealing damage interrupts his attacks, but he soon counters with a throwing technique. Evading the attack and hitting him while his guard is down makes him susceptible to staggering.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at driving up the gauge.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.
Inflicting a certain amount of damage makes them susceptible to staggering.
After repeated attacks, the arm section goes into a rampage. Inflict a certain amount of damage to shut down rampage mode and fill its stagger gauge.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.

Delivering a certain amount of damage or destroying an arm knocks it down, making it more susceptible to staggering. However, when it recovers, it activates rampage mode and becomes very difficult to stagger.
Its arms can only be destroyed when it is staggered.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.
Its stagger gauge is only affected by non-elemental and lightning magic. Of these, lightning magic is the more effective at filling the gauge.
Inflict a certain amount of damage to force it into a temporary rampage, which makes it susceptible to staggering.

Once it charges up enough electricity, it unleashes a highly potent special attack. For a short time after this attack, the unit is susceptible to staggering. In fact, this is the only time its stagger gauge can be filled.
Physical attacks rapidly fill its stagger gauge. If dealt a certain amount of physical damage while airborne, it will crash to the ground.
Physical attacks rapidly fill its stagger gauge. If dealt a certain amount of physical damage while airborne, it will crash to the ground.
Its stagger gauge is filled each time a certain amount of damage is inflicted.
Inflicting a certain amount of damage or using Yuffie and Sonon's synergized abilities will make it susceptible to staggering.
Pelting it with repeated magic attacks will render it susceptible to staggering. While it can easily deflect frontal attacks, its rear is vulnerable.
It projects the data of a diabolic creation to shield itself, and the creature must be dealt with before this device can be attacked.
Use magic attacks to rapidly fill their stagger gauge.
Unless they are in the middle of an attack or knocked off-balance, they evade all magic except for spells that are guaranteed to hit.

Normally their attacks cannot be interrupted, regardless of what ATB commands are used. Using certain attacks on them, however, sends them into a rampage, also making them susceptible to interruption.
It will retaliate against any attack made, but dodging or guarding against its counterattack will make it susceptible to staggering.
Inflicting a certain amount of damage makes them susceptible to staggering.
Ice attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge. They protect themselves with a barrier when low on health or isolated.
Inflicting a certain amount of damage makes her susceptible to staggering.

These creatures start spinning when interrupted. While in this state, they can shrug off melee attacks, so use long-range attacks instead. Stop them from spinning and they become susceptible to staggering.
Ice attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge. Knocking them off-balance causes them to rampage, making them harder to stagger.
Inflicting a certain amount of damage makes it susceptible to staggering. It enhances either itself or its comrades during battle, so target whoever is not currently affected by its powers.
They become stronger some time after battle starts, but they will return to normal after taking a certain amount of damage.

Hitting it while it is using Haywire Haze makes it susceptible to staggering. Lightning attacks will rapidly fill its stagger gauge.

His stagger gauge cannot normally be affected, but he becomes susceptible to staggering when in counterattack mode. His counterattacks are aborted when he is staggered.

While enveloped in darkness, they absorb all spells. However, inflicting a certain amount of damage while they cast Gravity will dispel the darkness and make them susceptible to staggering for a short while.
The horned alpha can restore its HP by cannibalizing these lesser cripshays.
Defeating the other cripshays will make it suspectible to staggering. It can recover HP by cannibalizing members of its pack.
They cast Shield when hit with physical attacks, and Reflect when hit with magic attacks. Use magic attacks when they have cast Shield and physical attacks when they have cast Reflect.

Dispelling its Reflect spells with Breach makes it susceptible to staggering.

<color=green>Enemy skills can be learned from this monster.</color>

Aim for their mouth when they use Bad Breath or Chow Down, as hitting them there will make them susceptible to staggering.

When holding a rock, it will repel and counter frontal attacks. Fire and ice attacks will rapidly fill its stagger gauge. If captured, continuously press evade to escape.

Severing its right appendage will weaken it and make it susceptible to staggering. When it has enshrouded a portion of its body in mist, attacking the affected area will cause it to counter with an explosion.

Extinguish either flame to weaken their attacks. Ice attacks will extinguish their red flame, while healing spells and items will extinguish their purple flame.
Cripple and knock down its upper or lower body. While one is knocked down, do the same to the other to stagger the beast. It will counter if attacked with spells while its horns are intact.
Ice attacks rapidly fill their stagger gauge. They rarely get interrupted unless attacked from the rear.
Physical attacks only have a slight effect on their stagger gauge, so use magic attacks to fill it rapidly.
Normally, attacks have only a slight effect on its stagger gauge, but the gauge fills more quickly after it has been interrupted.
